Content.Text: When applying lipstick, start in the middle, blot your lips together, and then move it around. Avoid going over the lip line and ensure both sides are evenly shaped.
Consider the depth and natural tones of your lips when selecting a lipstick shade. Experiment with different colors to find the best match for you.

Use a cotton swab and makeup remover to clean up any mistakes. Apply lipstick with a brush or pencil for better precision and longevity. A lip pencil can also be used to fill in the lips and adapt the color.

After applying lipstick, check your foundation and use a sponge to fix any spots. Add a bit of powder around the nose, mouth, and cheeks to set the makeup. Consider adding a touch of blush to complete the look.
